channel.title: USPTO Patent Events
channel.description: This feed provides easy access to USPTO Patent events.

item.title: One-day trademarks boot camp
item.description: Join the United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) for a one-day trademarks boot camp on February 28, 2024, from 9 a. m. to 5 p. m. CT at the Small Business Development Center in Hammond, Louisiana. This is an in-person, single-day workshop for entrepreneurs, small businesses, and start-ups in communities with limited or no internet access, covering what they should know about trademarks. The event explores what trademarks are, the benefits of federal trademark registration, and the basics of the registration process. We'll also discuss why it's so important for any new business to select a trademark that is both federally registrable and legally protectable. Topics will include: Fundamentals and searching Applications and filing Responses and registration There will be plenty of question-and-answer sessions throughout the day, plus a discussion about free resources available through the USPTO. This event is free, but registration is required. For registration information, questions about the one-day event, or the One-day patents and trademarks boot camp series, please email Andriae. Holt@uspto.gov.

item.title: Learn how to assess the strengths and weaknesses of a potential patent application
item.description: Do you have a concept or invention that you want to patent? Are you a potential first-time patent application filer? Are you interested in learning how to search public patent databases to find patent literature similar to your invention? Join us as we help you jump-start your entrepreneurial innovation journey, by guiding you through the pre-application process. Our free, two-day virtual workshop will show you how to search public patent databases to determine if your idea is completely new or has never been used for the same purpose before. Participants may also choose to participate in one-on-one assistance. Complete interest form Instructions for joining the training session will be emailed to each registrant. For more information, email setd@uspto.gov.

item.title: Ex Parte Appeal Roadshows - Atlanta
item.description: Are you a Patent Trial and Appeal Board (PTAB) practitioner? Would you like to learn more about ex parte appeal proceedings directly from PTAB judges? Attend an Ex Parte Appeal Roadshow. The PTAB is holding in-person training focusing on best practices to succeed in an appeal on Thursday, February 29, at the Emory School of Law from 1-5 p. m. ET. PTAB judges will teach all sessions. Topics include: Tips to file an appeal brief efficiently How to make written arguments more persuasive How to present an effective oral argument before a judge panel See the agenda for more information. The event is free and registration is encouraged. The Ex Parte Appeal Roadshow will also take place in Los Angeles, Austin, Indianapolis, and Philadelphia. See the full schedule for dates. If you have any questions regarding this event, please email PTABEvents@uspto.gov. CLE credit is pending per state for each roadshow location.

item.title: Attend DOCX filing training
item.description: Join us February 29, 2-3 p. m. ET (online) to learn how to file patent-related documents in DOCX format using Patent Center. You will hear from experts on the United States Patent and Trademark Office's (USPTO) eCommerce Modernization (e Mod) team, who will provide demonstrations and answer your questions. This session is one of several free training sessions found on the DOCX filing series page. Instructions for joining the Webex training session will be provided via email to each registrant. DOCX is a word processing file format based on open standards and is supported by many popular word processing applications. As an open standard format, DOCX offers a safe and stable basis for authoring and processing intellectual property documents. Learn more about filing in DOCX in this hour-long session. We encourage you to explore DOCX filing using the Patent Center training mode at any time. Training mode does not save or store data in USPTO systems. Register today For more information, please contact eMod@uspto.gov. To provide feedback, please visit the eMod Idea Scale.

item.title: One-day trademarks boot camp
item.description: Join the United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) for a one-day trademarks boot camp on March 14, 2024 from 9 a. m. to 5 p. m. ET at UMES Center for Entrepreneurship and Innovation in Princess Anne, Maryland. item.title: Patents for librarians
item.description: Are you a librarian looking for a better understanding of patent concepts? Do you want to be able to share reliable resources with inventors looking to protect their intellectual property? The United States Patent and Trademark Office's Patent and Trademark Resource Center Program is offering a new webinar that introduces patent concepts and resources for professional librarians and library staff. This webinar will cover: An overview of patent concepts Types of patents Parts of a patent Steps to apply for a patent Patent and Trademark Resource Centers (PTRCs) and how they can help Additional resources Please register to attend this free virtual webinar, which will be held on Tuesday, March 19, from 2-3 p. m. E. T. Register today For more information, email PTRCP@uspto.gov. Accessibility

item.title: USPTO PTAB/TTAB Stadium Tour — Live at Southern University
item.description: Are you a patent or trademark attorney who appears before the Patent Trial and Appeal Board (PTAB) and/or the Trademark Trial and Appeal Board (TTAB)? Are you interested in learning about intellectual property law or practicing before the PTAB or TTAB? If so, you should join the United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) and Southern University for an in-person PTAB/TTAB proceeding on March 28 from 10 a. m. to 7 p. m. CT at Southern University in Baton Rouge, Louisiana. Practitioners and students will have the opportunity to: Observe judges and counsel in action during the PTAB and TTAB proceedings. Attend a fireside chat with Derrick Brent, Deputy Under Secretary of Commerce for Intellectual Property and Deputy Director of the USPTO. Learn about the structure and format of PTAB proceedings and TTAB opposition proceedings. Join a networking reception after the proceedings and educational sessions. The program is free, but space is limited. We encourage you to register. If you have questions, email Marina A. Biragova, Director for Intellectual Property & Business Programs at SULC at MBiragova@sulc. edu. Presentation

item.title: One-day patents boot camp
item.description: Join the United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) for a one-day patents boot camp on April 4, 2024 from 9 a. m. to 5 p. m. CT at WKU Innovation Campus in Bowling Green, KY. This in-person, single-day workshop is for entrepreneurs, small businesses, and inventors in communities with limited or no internet access, covering tools, techniques, and resources to understand the patent application process. The event provides a scaffolded approach to understanding patents and intellectual property (IP) rights, the importance of claims in a patent application, and the various patent application requirements. It also includes: How to search prior art How to properly draft claims Understanding the application forms How to use Patent Center to file electronically There will be plenty of question-and-answer sessions throughout the day, plus a discussion about free resources available through the USPTO. This event is free, but registration is required. For registration information, questions about the one-day event or the One-day patent and trademark boot camp series, please email Andriae. Holt@uspto.gov.

item.title: Ex Parte Appeal Roadshows - Indianapolis, Indiana
item.description: Are you a Patent Trial and Appeal Board (PTAB) practitioner? Would you like to learn more about ex parte appeal proceedings directly from PTAB judges? Attend an Ex Parte Appeal Roadshow. The PTAB is holding in-person training focusing on best practices to succeed in an appeal on Thursday, April 4, at the Indianapolis Central Library from 1-5 p. m. ET. PTAB judges will teach all sessions. Topics include: Tips to file an appeal brief efficiently How to make written arguments more persuasive How to present an effective oral argument before a judge panel See the agenda for more information. The event is free and registration is encouraged. The Ex Parte Appeal Roadshow will also take place in Los Angeles, Austin, Atlanta, and Philadelphia. See the full schedule for dates. If you have any questions regarding this event, please email PTABEvents@uspto.gov. CLE credit is pending per state for each roadshow location.

item.description: This event has been postponed until further notice. Please refer to this listing for updates and information. item.title: One-day patents boot camp
item.description: Join the United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) for a one-day patents boot camp on April 18, 2024 from 9 a. m. to 5 p. m. ET at the Summit Station at Innovation Center in Frostburg, Maryland. This is an in-person, single-day workshop for entrepreneurs, small businesses, and inventors in communities with limited or no internet access, covering tools, techniques, and resources to understand the patent application process. The event provides a scaffolded approach to understanding patents and intellectual property (IP) rights, the importance of claims in a patent application, and the various patent application requirements. This event is free, but registration is required. For registration information, questions about the one-day event or the One-day patent and trademark boot camp series, please email Andriae. Holt@uspto.gov.
